body:
I think you are probably looking for the `--progress` or `-P` flag in [the latest beta](https://beta.rclone.org).

This will output updating stats to the terminal and you can send the log elsewhere with --log-file.

The latest beta results in this for me so i was unable to test it
C:\rclone\rclone.exe sync --delete-after --bwlimit 3M --delete-excluded --exclude-from "C:/rclone/Configs/Exclusions.txt" --progress --stats 0m --log-file "Rclone Mirror_D 2018-09-01  43037-Simulate.log" --log-level DEBUG --dry-run D:/ cryptGDrive:D


2018/09/01 04:30:38 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.42-157-gb4d86d54" starting with parameters ["C:\\rclone\\rclone.exe" "sync" "--delete-after" "--bwlimit" "3M" "--delete-excluded" "--exclude-from" "C:/rclone/Configs/Exclusions.txt" "--progress" "--stats" "0m" "--log-file" "Rclone Mirror_D 2018-09-01  43037-Simulate.log" "--log-level" "DEBUG" "--dry-run" "D:/" "cryptGDrive:D"]
2018/09/01 04:30:38 DEBUG : Using config file from "C:\\Users\\Username\\.config\\rclone\\rclone.conf"
2018/09/01 04:30:38 INFO  : Starting bandwidth limiter at 3MBytes/s
panic: non-positive interval for NewTicker

goroutine 25 [running]:
time.NewTicker(0x0, 0xc0003a3f58)
	C:/go/src/time/tick.go:23 +0x196
github.com/ncw/rclone/cmd.startProgress.func2(0xc00006c300, 0x11c2bc0)
	C:/gopath/src/github.com/ncw/rclone/cmd/progress.go:44 +0x58
created by github.com/ncw/rclone/cmd.startProgress
	C:/gopath/src/github.com/ncw/rclone/cmd/progress.go:39 +0x89
Remove the "--stats 0m" and it will work.  I'll fix that now!

I've fixed that in [the latest beta](https://beta.rclone.org) (uploaded in 15-30 mins).

Note that 1.43 is released which should work provided you don't use `--progress` and `--stats 0` together!

I've found an issue

When --progress is enabled i sometimes get a lot of these errors in the console.

`*** Error from ANSI parser: New state of 'nil' is invalid.`

After some investigation the following filename wil trigger this. These are chinese characters. Japanese and Korean characters don't seem to be an issue though

> 狐妖小红娘.ext

Test command
`C:\rclone\rclone.exe sync --delete-after --delete-excluded --exclude-from "C:/rclone/Configs/Exclusions.txt" --progress --log-file "C:\Users\username\Desktop\Rclone TEST.log" --log-level DEBUG E:/test/ cryptGDrive:TEST`

I suspect it is related to this issue: https://github.com/Azure/go-ansiterm/issues/26

Do you see any non-ASCII characters in the terminal?

no i don't see them.


Japanese and korean characters are not shown and do not generate errors.
eg.
> あずまんが大王1.ext

Will show in --progress
> ...1.ext


Chinese characters generate the before mentioned error
eg.
> 狐妖小红娘1.ext

Will generate an error instead of --progress
> *** Error from ANSI parser: New state of 'nil' is invalid.


Personally i don't really care that the utf8 characters are not shown, just as long as the error is suppressed since that actually blocks showing "--progress"

To my knowledge on windows you will also have an issue with the font that is used by default in terminals so utf8 in terminal might not be possible without adjusting that

In this specific situation the ANSI parser error is useless in my opinion.
I'm not sure what other situations it might occur and might actually be wanted

So suppressing the error would be fine for me. Another option is to move the error to log level DEBUG. Since debug is used to test mostly, production environments would not be affected

I supressed the error here.

Can you have a go with it?  Does the ansiparser display something sensible even though there was an error?

https://beta.rclone.org/branch/v1.43-075-ge367b399-fix-2501-progress-errors-beta/ (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

Thanks

rename.from: Stats to terminal while logging to file
rename.to: --progress on windows for certain chinese characters prints errors

body:
I'm sorry to say but its not fixed.
The error is not shown. Thats good. But the progress is also not shown as can be seen from the screenshot

Rclone 1.43-075-ge367b399-fix-2501-progress-errors-beta
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/912973/45571254-f23b9980-b865-11e8-920e-eabf529cb8d8.png)

Rclone 1.43.1:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/912973/45571355-3a5abc00-b866-11e8-9105-a0b93b807a72.png)

issue.title: Console output does not properly get cleared before updating it

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?
Just wanted to let you know that with the Windows 10 1809 update the console does not clear old output properly. In Windows 10 1803 this was not an issue but with 1809 it is. See the effect below and compare it to other screenshots from #2501 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/912973/46435761-6aa3c500-c757-11e8-871f-4db9d342935a.png)

When the issue from #2501 is not present and we have normal output the end of the transferring lines contains a countdown timer to completion for that file. As it counts down you get multiple "s" at the end because it starts as "1h5m10s" which becomes smaller and eventually showing "1ssssss"


#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)
1.43.1


#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)
Windows 10 1809


####  Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)
Google Drive

body:
OK I had another idea - here I just replace all non-ASCII characters with `.`

I think that should fix the strange behaviour - it isn't ideal but hopefully will do until the upstream bug is fixed.

https://beta.rclone.org/branch/v1.43-137-g60dac68f-fix-2501-progress-errors-beta/ (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

What do you think of that @SL-Gundam ?

For "v1.43-137-g60dac68f-fix-2501-progress-errors-beta" the windows version is still not available so i tested against "v1.43-139-g87ef3cc6-fix-2438-s3-v2-sign-beta"
Not sure whether this change is present in that version

To my knowledge its not an issue for the command prompt if you output UTF8. It will just show a question mark since the font being used does not support UTF8 characters (based on my experience with robocopy). It should suffice to make sure that Rclone's ANSI Parser does not stumble on the UTF8 characters.

See the result below. I'm afraid its unchanged

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/912973/46686724-52b9be80-cbf9-11e8-93a3-763d08de3e16.png)

@SL-Gundam 

The windows build bot decided to take a holiday!

Try this one instead

https://beta.rclone.org/branch/v1.43-138-gf6c174e9-fix-2501-progress-errors-beta/ (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

Thanks
